intro: Marrubium vulgare var. lanatum, commonly known as hairy horehound, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its silver-gray, fuzzy leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in dry, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Marrubium vulgare var. lanatum has been used traditionally in herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
